newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo corn futures end sharply higher.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo corn futures end sharply higher.

text.p: Tokyo corn futures closed sharply higher on Friday, as speculative buying from local investors supported all contracts, traders said.
Prices were 110 to 280 yen higher, and the benchmark January 1998 contract was up 110 yen at 15,110 yen per tonne. The day's volume was 102,632 lots.
Active buying from individual investors emerged although the Chicago market overnight ended mixed, traders said.
"Soybean is now leading the Chicago grain market. But in Tokyo, corn still has more active trading interest," a brokerage house trader said.
The spot March corn contract on the CBOT Project A trading system was being traded at $2.73-1/2 per bushel at 0805 GMT, unchanged from Thursday's close.
The spot January for CBOT soybean futures on the overnight trading system was at $7.40 at 0805 GMT, down from $7.47-1/2 at Thursday's close.
